user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_FileOpenCheck:
```c
int32 OS_FileOpenCheck(const char *Filename)
{
    int32                        return_code;
    OS_object_iter_t             iter;
    OS_stream_internal_record_t *stream;

    /* Check parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(Filename);

    return_code = OS_ERROR;

    OS_ObjectIdIterateActive(LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, &iter);

    while (OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext(&iter))
    {
        stream = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_stream_table, iter.token);
        if (stream->socket_domain == OS_SocketDomain_INVALID && (strcmp(stream->stream_name, Filename) == 0))
        {
            return_code = OS_SUCCESS;
            break;
        }
    }

    OS_ObjectIdIteratorDestroy(&iter);

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_FileOpenCheck:
typedef struct
{
    char   stream_name[OS_MAX_PATH_LEN];
    uint8  socket_domain;
    uint8  socket_type;
    uint16 stream_state;
} OS_stream_internal_record_t
...
OS_stream_internal_record_t OS_stream_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES]
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The function parameter 'Filename' is already a const-qualified pointer, so it does not need investigation for Rule 8.13. Local non-pointer variables (return_code, iter) and the iterator control calls (OS_ObjectIdIterateActive, OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext, OS_ObjectIdIteratorDestroy) do not introduce pointers that could/should be const-qualified in this context. The OS_CHECK_POINTER(Filename) macro only validates the incoming pointer and does not change constness. There are no other pointer declarations or pointer-returning expressions in the function besides the ones listed above that are read-only uses of the referenced object and thus candidates for const qualification; therefore they are the relevant fragments to investigate for compliance with MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13.
